body:
r? @huonw

(rust_highfive has picked a reviewer for you, use r? to override)
The actual file defining the module should be removed as well.
Since the last commit does the exact same thing as #22503, I think we can close #22503.

@bors: r-

Er actually the `pub use isize as int;` annotations in `libstd/lib.rs` also need to be removed I believe.
My last commit did or maybe I misunderstood you... What line where you talking about ?
@alexcrichton for some reason github displays the new commit above your r+ comment, although it is newer than that

:zap: Previous build results are reusable. Rebuilding only [auto-linux-32-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-32-nopt-t/builds/3854), [auto-linux-32-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-32-opt/builds/3858), [auto-linux-64-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-64-nopt-t/builds/3848), [auto-linux-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-64-opt/builds/3858), [auto-linux-64-x-android-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-64-x-android-t/builds/3826), [auto-mac-32-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-32-opt/builds/3876), [auto-mac-64-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-64-nopt-t/builds/3881), [auto-mac-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-64-opt/builds/3869), [auto-win-32-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-32-nopt-t/builds/3530), [auto-win-32-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-32-opt/builds/3521), [auto-win-64-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-64-nopt-t/builds/2350), [auto-win-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-64-opt/builds/2358)...

This one fails tests from `libcoretest` :/

Please run a `make check-stage1`, at least `make check-stage1-crates`. It's hard to fix up pull requests that break unit tests since they trigger a full rebuild.
